column2: KANSAS PERMIT TEST
column4: Kansas
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 2. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 3. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column6: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 4. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.

column2: 5. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 6. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
column8: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 7. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: a divided highway is ahead.
column8: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 8. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 9. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: apply the brake firmly and stop.
column6: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column8: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.

column2: 10. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: suggested speed
column6: maximum speed

column2: 11. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column4: stay off the brakes.
column6: turn off the ignition.

column2: 12. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: no passing zone
column6: soft shoulder

column2: 13. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Brake early and gently.

column2: 14. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column6: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column8: speed up and proceed through the intersection.

column2: 15. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the right.
column6: vehicles from the left.

column2: 16. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column6: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.

column2: 17. You should always travel:
column4: at the speed limit.
column6: according to weather and road conditions.
column8: at the speed of the vehicle behind.

column2: 18. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Slow down.
column6: Yield.

column2: 19. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: fix
column6: replace

column2: 20. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column8: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

column2: 21. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column8: indicate you are in a no passing zone.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right
column6: All traffic must go straight ahead
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 23. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for bicycles
column6: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 25. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column4: all students are off the bus.
column6: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.
